snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump could try to overhaul the Federal Reserve. Or he could emulate Ronald Reagan and leave the central bank alone....
abstract: Analysts ponder what changes Pres-elect Donald J Trump plans for Federal Reserve; say new administration could support Republicans' insistence on overhauling Fed and minimizing its influence on national economy, including replacing chairwoman Janet Yellen when her term is up in February 2018; others say Trump will leave central bank alone in order to concentrate on reigniting economy through tax and trade reforms and other growth-building strategies.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump could try to overhaul the Federal Reserve. Or he could emulate Ronald Reagan and leave the central bank alone.

headline.main: With Trump in Power, the Fed Gets Ready for a Reckoning
headline.print_headline: The Fed Gets Ready for a Reckoning
